google_reviews.author: Raf Xander
google_reviews.review:
Pros:
- Relatively close to WCC, The Guide Meridian Bellis Fair and bus stops.
- Online portal for rental payment and maintenance requests
- Rent increases have been relatively minor compared to other rental properties
-Staff and owners go outside of the box to help residents from time to time

Cons
- Lack of parking (Depending on which building youre in, this gets worse during renovations)
- Proximity to unhoused encampments, etc. (Had to ask someone to not sleep in our parking garage)
- Occasional car break-ins
- Neighbors sometimes, people pull some real petty nonsense.

Overall, good for what it is if you have the right expectations going in. Fill out your entry form correctly, know your rights as a renter and keep cameras in your apartment/car if youre able. Its decent for the most part.

The gym is just a small room with four machines in it, and the playground is just as small and pitiful. When I expressed to them what was holding me back from moving there, they basically told me dont bother and they blocked my number so I couldnt respond. All in all I did not have a good experience with their staff and I do not recommend them at all.

google_reviews.author: Seldom Pearce
google_reviews.review: I am currently in my second year long lease agreement with them and I am very pleased. They do not claim to be a low-income housing property, and this is one of the reasons my partner and I chose the complex. Despite this, their prices are actually very reasonable considering the location, size of the units, etc. They are quite welcoming of pets, their on-site maintenance staff are friendly and have always responded quickly to our admittedly few issues. The office staff have always been courteous, polite, professional and kind when Ive dealt with them and now that we have a renters portal where we can pay our rent automatically we literally have no complaints. I highly recommend ANYONE to rent here.

google_reviews.author: Trace Evans
google_reviews.review:
Where to begin. I have been renting with this complex for almost 4 years. I take my finances seriously and make it a point to drop my rent check off first thing every 1st of the month. Over the last 4-5 months they have accused me 3 times of not paying on time. Each time I had to spend my time jumping through hoops just to have the charges removed. This third time, however, they are being very difficult and the office manager is treating me, a long term, good standing tenant, with an aloof and callous attitude, and even laughed at me when I brought the concern to her attention. It is to the point now that Ive retained a lawyer to help me fight this miserable place. Rental history is extremely important so when they laugh at my concern, I take it personally. If you can help it, dont rent here. They are over-priced, small, and the office staff changes frequently. Im now on the third round of staff, and none have made me feel that my business is respected. I can only imagine what tenants who struggle with money and cant always pay on time go through with this place. They have no concern for the well-being pfntheir tenata, even those who pay on time, every time.
They charge erroneous fees and rent jumps by at least $30 every year. Pet fees are insane. $300 deposit and $300 Non-refundable fee plus pet rent every month. This is for 1 cat. I will be glad to leave this place.

google_reviews.author: Emmanuel Waore
google_reviews.review: This complex is great. The rent is reasonable for the size of the unit. The main office staff is friendly and helpful as well as the on site maintenance team who are efficient and resourceful at fixing problems. It's has pet friendly units and is silent at night (at least my block is). Plus a gym and lounge with a pool table. I'd recommend them to add a designated smoking zone so people stop smoking in the parking lot. It would save them face value for future residents.

summary.text:
Good

Some user reviews express satisfaction with certain aspects of Belleau Woods Apartments, particularly appreciating the property's convenience with its close proximity to public amenities, such as WCC and The Guide Meridian Bellis Fair. Others praised specific elements such as an online rental payment system, on-site maintenance, and the staff's occasional willingness to go beyond typical duties to assist residents.

Despite the mix of sentiments found among the user reviews, an undercurrent of satisfaction comes through from tenants who appreciate the pet-friendly policies, the quietness of certain apartment blocks at night, and the fact that the apartments are equipped with essential facilities like a gym and a lounge area. These points of contentment, although not universal, indicate that for some, Belleau Woods Apartments has been a satisfactory home.

Great

Residents have highlighted great experiences, emphasizing the staff's friendliness and helpfulness at times, which has contributed to a positive living environment for some. There are accounts of on-site maintenance staff being efficient and resourceful, addressing issues with promptness and professionalism. The office staff have been noted for their courteous and polite interactions with tenants, creating an overall amiable atmosphere.

Not to be overlooked, some reviews reveal that the rental prices at Belleau Woods Apartments are deemed reasonable considering the apartment sizes and location. Additionally, the community's policy on pets has been highly regarded by many pet owners as a great benefit. With these positive experiences, the apartments have been recommended by various satisfied tenants, suggesting a welcomed living situation for individuals and families alike.

Bad

User reviews of Belleau Woods Apartments have indicated issues such as miscommunication and instances of perceived rudeness from the staff. Residents have reported frequent management changes that contribute to an environment of inconsistency and frustration, with the office staff sometimes coming across as indifferent or uncooperative. Several reviewers have recounted experiences of being inaccurately billed for rent or other miscellaneous charges, reflecting broader concerns over the management's handling of financial transactions.

Another recurring complaint mentioned in the user reviews is the problem with parking. With limited and crowded spaces, tenants have expressed dissatisfaction over what seems to be an oversight in community planning, leading to potential safety hazards. Furthermore, remarks about dated and cramped apartments have surfaced, with some users considering them overpriced given their condition. Such recurring themes in the bad aspects of reviews point to a general discontent with the way the property is managed and how resident concerns are addressed.

Ugly

The "ugly" side of Belleau Woods Apartments, as reported by users, involves serious allegations of negligence concerning security and property maintenance. Instances of car break-ins and thefts within the compound appear to be common, with a notable absence of security cameras or measures to prevent such incidents. Reviews also document cases where maintenance issues, such as water damage and mold, persisted for extended periods without adequate response from the staff, raising health and safety concerns among the residents.

Apart from physical neglect, interactions with the management have been described as hostile, with accounts of staff members being condescending and even retaliatory towards tenants. Grim descriptions include the sighting of rodents, inadequate responses to damage caused by environmental factors, and blatant disregard for tenant property. Some reviewers have expressed a sense of relief in leaving the complex, while others have warned prospective tenants to steer clear, painting a stark picture of an apartment community in distress.
